instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936-A no chime no video
threads.message: This board turns on, no liquid damage or so. It wont chime or give image on screen or DP. 3V on LCD are present. I asume this is a dead PCH

threads.title: 820-2936-A no chime no video
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 4577"]CPU Vcore present???[/QUOTE]
CPU Vcore present

threads.title: 820-2936-A no chime no video
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 4584"]USB activity??? Beeps without memory??[/QUOTE]
Beeps without memory, yes. And red light on external mouse. I forgot to mention all this before. Seems like the LVDS part of the PCH is k.o.???

threads.title: 820-2936-A no chime no video
threads.message: So the boards works but there is no display. Is there 3V on C9015 and C9010?

threads.title: 820-2936-A no chime no video
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 4590"]So the boards works but there is no display. Is there 3V on C9015 and C9010?[/QUOTE]

No 3V on C9015 but 3V on Q9010. No LCD_IG_PWR_EN on U9000... and that comes from the PCH...

threads.title: 820-2936-A no chime no video
threads.message: Do you have video on external monitor???

threads.title: 820-2936-A no chime no video
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 5033"]Do you have video on external monitor???[/QUOTE]
Nope, i don't have

threads.title: 820-2936-A no chime no video
threads.message: Do a PRAM reset, does it chime after? Disconnect battery indicator and check if SMC_LID is high.
